HEA_composition.composition: Equimolar and five non-equimolar (one transition metal concentration doubled)

synthesis.precursors: Lanthanum nitrate hexahydrate, Cr, Mn, Fe, Co, Ni metal sulfates

reaction_conditions.post_synthesis: dried at 60 °C and heat-treated at 750 °C for 12 hours

XPS.peak_shift: Binding energy shifts indicating metal oxidation states

physicochemical_characterization.HAADF-STEM: Uniform distribution of metal elements in each nanoparticle
physicochemical_characterization.EDX_maps: Elemental distribution consistent with ICP-MS results

electrochemical_performance.mass_activity_A_mg: Not explicitly quantified; highest TOF and intrinsic activity observed for L5M2Co
electrochemical_performance.stability: Excellent electrochemical stability for 50 hours at 10 mA cm−2

theoretical_computations.reaction_mechanism: DFT calculations show that Mn4+ and Co3+ contribute significantly to OER activity. The reaction mechanism is dominated by the Adsorbate Evolution Mechanism (AEM), with *O and *OOH being the key intermediates.
